Title: Sound Visualization Using Typography Composition Based GIF
Source title: ICSECC 2019 - International Conference on Sustainable Engineering and Creative Computing: New Idea, New Innovation, Proceedings
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara School of Technology, Visual Communication Design, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fadillah, C., Bina Nusantara School of Technology, Visual Communication Design, Bandung, Indonesia; Rahayu, R.R.A., Bina Nusantara School of Technology, Visual Communication Design, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: Visual communication design is a creative communication process, in which it combines art to encode and decode the message. As the technology advances, visual design communication explore further, paving ways to visualize something that doesn't have the visual attribute; sound, something that can only be perceived through auditory senses. The sound is transformed by controlling symbols, images, color movement into an image, using a visual programming software combined with typography composition, to create GIF (Graphic Interchange Format) as the final product. Sound visualization opens the possibility to experience sounds without even hearing it. It is an experimental tool to experience sound, to give an even deeper meaning of a message, and to bridge the possibilities to convey sound to the hearing impairment, those who carry disability, expanding the minds and horizon so they can experience sound. © 2019 IEEE.
